messages.message: Customer has been testing the same reasoning prompt "extract all the lines between "20 Other information" and "21"" across a number of K1 documents. But they were only able to get the values correctly extracted in one the files (screenshot 1). I noticed that one of the files has OCR issues but even for other files that were OCRed correctly, the results were still incorrect (screenshot 2-4). Anyone has any suggestions?
Maybe unrelated, but this reminds me, did we fix the bug with quotes in prompts @lydia?
Do we have any K1 files internally? This is a prompt eng problem, most of us are not familiar with K1 — a few test files will help.
I took screenshots from the customer's sample K1 documents.

Hmm I tried a bunch of different prompts, but I just can't get the model to extract the right information across all the docs. I think our text view is maybe not sufficient for the model to understand the document, and that it really needs to see the image with this kind of structured-form document.

I agree with Lydia here. Recently as we’ve added a lot more features im starting to feel the limitations of a text only input to the model. 

Ideally I need the model to see lines and grids for it to be able to relate the correct info together. This should also help with checkboxes. 

Is this something we’re currently looking into?
@Clemens this is another example related to our discussion the other day.
